meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of microsomes.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the microsomal structure of the cell.
meanings.sent2: The microsomal properties of the organelle were fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent3: The tiny microsomal organelle threw a party for all the other cell components.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a microsomal explosion, spreading ideas everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The microsomal characteristics of the enzyme made it highly efficient in its function.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a cellular organelle that is a small vesicle containing enzymes and is involved in the production of proteins.
meanings.sent1: The microsomal organelle played a crucial role in protein synthesis.
meanings.sent2: Proteins are produced in the microsomal vesicles within the cell.
meanings.sent3: The microsomal vesicle told jokes to the other organelles during lunch break.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work was like a microsomal factory, churning out results.
meanings.sent5: The microsomal enzymes worked tirelessly to ensure protein production in the cell.
